page.title: 08JAWBONES HILL
page.content: This is a peaceful country lane which used to be one of the carters' tracks down into Dartmouth.Up near the toll house we found these flowers,Foxglove, Meadow Vetchling,Birdsfoot Trefoil,St. John's Wort,Red Campion,Scabious and Yarrow.The North bank had a hedge along it and we counted 4 tree species in 100m,Oak,Gorse,Blackthorn and Elder.We saw an old barn made of bricks and stone and had a clear view across Start Bay.The building next to the town water tower used to be an abbattoir,now it used as a car repair shop.They're building a rugby pitch nearby.The pitch is just being straightened out.It will be ready in about 5 months time.
